verses.text_plain: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
verses.verse_html: 1The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

verses.text_plain: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the Lord hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.
verses.verse_html: 2Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the Lord hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.

verses.text_plain: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.
verses.verse_html: 3The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.

verses.text_plain: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the Lord, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.
verses.verse_html:
4Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the Lord, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward. ▼
▼ laden: Heb. of heaviness
 , ▼
▼ gone…: Heb. alienated, or, separated

footnotes.body_html: ▼ laden: Heb. of heaviness
▼ gone…: Heb. alienated, or, separated

verses.text_plain: Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.
verses.verse_html:
5Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint. ▼
▼ revolt…: Heb. increase revolt

footnotes.body_html: ▼ revolt…: Heb. increase revolt

verses.text_plain: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.
verses.verse_html:
6From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment. ▼
▼ ointment: or, oil

verses.text_plain: Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
verses.verse_html:
7Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers. ▼
▼ overthrown…: Heb. the overthrow of

footnotes.body_html: ▼ overthrown…: Heb. the overthrow of

verses.text_plain: And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.
verses.verse_html: 8And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.

verses.text_plain: Except the Lord of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.
verses.verse_html: 9Except the Lord of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.

verses.text_plain: Hear the word of the Lord, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.
verses.verse_html: 10Hear the word of the Lord, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.

verses.text_plain: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the Lord: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.
verses.verse_html:
11To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the Lord: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats. ▼
▼ he goats: Heb. great he goats

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he goats: Heb. great he goats
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he goats: Heb. great he goats

verses.text_plain: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts?
verses.verse_html:
12When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts? ▼
▼ to appear: Heb. to be seen

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to appear: Heb. to be seen
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to appear: Heb. to be seen

verses.text_plain: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting.
verses.verse_html:
13Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting. ▼
▼ iniquity: or, grief

verses.text_plain: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.
verses.verse_html: 14Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.

verses.text_plain: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.
verses.verse_html:
15And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood. ▼
▼ make…: Heb. multiply prayer
 , ▼
▼ blood: Heb. bloods

tokens.text: from you: yea, when ye make many

footnotes.body_html: ▼ make…: Heb. multiply prayer

verses.text_plain: Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;
verses.verse_html: 16Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;

verses.text_plain: Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.
verses.verse_html:
17Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow. ▼
▼ relieve: or, righten

verses.text_plain: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.
verses.verse_html: 18Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

verses.text_plain: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:
verses.verse_html: 19If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:

verses.text_plain: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
verses.verse_html: 20But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

verses.text_plain: How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
verses.verse_html: 21How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.

verses.text_plain: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:
verses.verse_html: 22Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:

verses.text_plain: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.
verses.verse_html: 23Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.

verses.text_plain: Therefore saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:
verses.verse_html: 24Therefore saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:

verses.text_plain: And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:
verses.verse_html:
25And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin: ▼
▼ purely: Heb. according to pureness

footnotes.body_html: ▼ purely: Heb. according to pureness

verses.text_plain: And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.
verses.verse_html: 26And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.

verses.text_plain: Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.
verses.verse_html:
27Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness. ▼
▼ her…: or, they that return of her

footnotes.body_text: ▼ her…: or, they that return of her
footnotes.body_html: ▼ her…: or, they that return of her

verses.text_plain: And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the Lord shall be consumed.
verses.verse_html:
28And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the Lord shall be consumed. ▼
▼ destruction: Heb. breaking

verses.text_plain: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.
verses.verse_html: 29For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.

verses.text_plain: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
verses.verse_html: 30For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.

tokens.text: For ye shall be as an oak

verses.text_plain: And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
verses.verse_html:
31And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them. ▼
▼ maker…: or, and his work

footnotes.body_html: ▼ maker…: or, and his work
